WRITING.TEXT: She asked for my opinion, we disagreed on taste, and she asked me to post this on the internet to see what other ppl think. She thinks that the old kitchen is too bland and wants to change it up, but she isn't sure this is the right colour. What colour would you choose to paint this? And what do you think of her design?
No need to apologize :) We agreed that which side that gets more votes will be how the kitchen is.

Painted kitchen wall. Thoughts?
http://imgur.com/a/mwKs2

WRITING.TITLE: My mom painted her kitchen. Need opinions.
WRITING.TEXT:
link: http://imgur.com/a/mwKs2
She painted parts of the kitchen wall turquoise. Personally, I don't like the change, the blue is too bright and clashes with the rest of the wall, but she likes it, so we want third-party opinions.
Please tell me if you like the change or not, and why. Also, if you were to paint this kitchen, what colour would you choose?
Like to dislike ratio: outdated and I'm too lazy to update
Update: it seems more ppl dislike the blue than those who do, taking this into account, we decided the blue should go. Thanks for everyone who pitched in!

how do you get the bullet points??
***
Yes, I believe aliens are out there. The universe is so big that there's gotta be planets that harbor life; out of the trillions of planets, even a minute chance of life would result in thousands of civilizations. Theoretically, there should be plenty of alien civilizations more advanced than us. Earth is a pretty young planet - 4.5 billion years old, the universe reached the ability to harbor life about 10 billion years ago, other planets can be billions of years older and have much more time to develop intelligent life. The thing is there isn't anyone out there - that we know of, and that makes me worried, or anxious, or whatever you're supposed to feel stuck on a wet mud ball in endless space all alone.
About discovering alien life, I would err on the cautious side. God, don't we have enough problems on Earth as it is, to not go looking for more? I don't wanna worry about intergalactic politics. Also, look what happened when the Europeans discovered America. What if the aliens bring a plague? I think if we ever find aliens, we should take things slowly.
Careers? Translators for sure, I bet the space travel industry will become really popular, and perhaps tourism? Maybe aliens like beer, who knows? Do they have internet, what do they even use to communicate? There will certainly be mailing services, I bet amazon will change their one-day delivery policy, though. The military's gonna go crazy, I'm sure. Send spies to other planets and develop anti-alien-invasion weapons.
In my opinion, we shouldn't meddle with aliens before we solve our own issues. It will be nice to know we're not alone though.

I have one of those, the best thing about them is they don't leave crumbs on your drawings, so you won't accidentally smear your sketches when brushing them off like with a normal eraser. You can use it to dot (is that the right word?) your drawings to lighten overly shaded areas like you would a sponge on paintings. A useful thing to have, although it gradually soakes up more lead and gets harder, eventually to the point you'll have to get a new one.

Not OP, you can use a thin eraser to create highlights too. Not sure about hair, but when you draw stuff like glass that has a lot of reflections, you erase out the highlights last with erasers. Take my word with a grain of salt though, it's been a few years since my last drawing lessons.

Sorry, but can you explain why it'll enter the atmosphere every orbit? You can clearly tell I don't know much about physics, but I'm just toying with this idea. Theoretically, can you launch the cannonball at a really high speed, say, 90% of the speed of light (a lil too fast but you get what I'm saying), and have it stay in orbit, or will it just overheat the air and generate plasma and explosions and all that shit due to the atmosphere?
Yeah but thats basically how they launch rockets. I was exploring the idea of shooting a canon on the ground, sideways, and have it go into orbit.
What if its really fast? Is there no way at all?

You don't need to go high to go to space, you just need to go fast. I think it was 8km per second, correct me if I'm wrong.
Can you launch a cannonball into orbit by firing it at the horizon really fast? Assuming there's no obstacles in the way.
